Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: Wrenchman52
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel right in the historic center of Rome - 5-minute walk from Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori, Piazza Venezia and via del Corso. Close to a food store and a number of restaurants. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are large, clean and have new furniture, towels and linens are changed every day. Bathroom is terrific - large and modern. Good Wi-Fi connection. A bus stop is right at the entrance of the hotel. Right around the corner you can find lots of taxi cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad, ultimately good”
Reviews.Author: spectactic
Reviews.Content: It was August 2011 and everyone and everything was hot. I believe this is the reason why the front desk help was a little short with my fiance and I and didn't seem to care much about our experience. They did not want to give us directions to anything (probably because the bus stop was right outside and we could figure it out if we Googled it. We stayed four nights. And maybe I should have known this, but I was told at check-in that the Roma tax would be combined with our payment for the room. It wasn't. The ATM was just around the corner, but I guess at that point I really didn't want to get more cash out... I begrudgingly did anyway :) The AC was controlled by the desk and was not changed when we asked for it to be cooler in our room. It was way better than outside, so we decided not to complain. And hey, the breakfast was great, and we were happy to be staying at such a perfectly located hotel for 90 Euros a night. Easy to get to the hotel from the train station - easy to get to the airport from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: atoorva
Reviews.Content: The rooms are neat( not large ) and the staff is very very helpful. They sorted out the wi-fi connectivity problem with my smartphone and laptop in one day . The reception guys always have sensible answers about bus numbers , distance etc . The breakfast is good...though it never changes. There is a very good selection of breads, fruits, cereal and cakes. Bathrooms are very clean and though I stayed on the streetside, i never heard too much noise to disturb me . But the greatest advantage of this place is its location, 80% of the rome attractions are within 15 min walk, including the vatican city. The location is fabulous . The place is surrounded by nice eateries and has a tram station just next door. The place is located at a bus stop, so catching a bus was easy. Its a very safe locality and we never faced any problem while walking upto Piazza Navona, Pantheon etc in early morning or late evenings .

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: BirgitteCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Della Torre Argentina as a family 3days between Christmas and New Year and had a jolly good time. The rooms were nice, clean and even though we stayed with a view to the busy street we had a good sleep. The people in the reception were helpful. Only complaint is the breakfast. Coffee from a machine is not satisfactory, choose the tea instead. And who eats all the cakes for breakfast? With a little improvement the breakfast would be a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Don938
Reviews.Content: We are an American couple who live about two hours North of Rome. We are always on the hunt for a good hotel value and this one comes close. If we stay for three nights we always get an apartment because it is much cheaper, the locations tend to be quieter and you get to live with the Italians. Our room was small, but certainly adequate. The bathroom was new and very nice. The room and the hotel in general was clean although the hall carpeting had see better days. Our room included a pants pressing unit, but since they only supplied 3 coat hangers, all or our clothes got pressed. The breakfast was certainly a treat. Italians are not breakfast eaters other than a caffe' and a roll so it is unusual to get a good breakfast. Our room was very hot so we had to leave the window open at night until about 5:00AM when the traffic started to pick up. This problem is not isolated to this hotel, but seems to be a common condition everywhere in the world. We tried to get the heat turned off to our room, but it didn't seem to matter. We were treated well by all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location!”
Reviews.Author: GiniGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Great central location. Just step outside the door and the bus stop is just there! Easy walk to great sights like Piazza Navona; Pantheon; Trevi Fountain. We travelled with two young children and booked a quad room. Good size. traditional decor, although the bathroom was quite new and modern. The breakfast was wonderful with a good selection. The dining room had great character. Definitely opt for good location when in Rome! Yes, it might be a bit noisy and busy around, but that is Rome! Enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chayo_11
Reviews.Content: Last october we stayed in this hotel, and were very pleased with the location. Walking distance to all the main attractions!! The rooms are nice and the bathrooms excellent!! The breakfast was wonderful, the best we had in Italy!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: EamonnHackett
Reviews.Content: good sized family room with large clean bathroom- location is excellent base to walk to all key attractions/sites. Very good breakfast selection served in bright basement restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Della Torre Argentina”
Reviews.Author: DebbieT11_11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were very pleased with our accommodations at Della Torre Argentina. Our room was on the top floor with a wonderful, large open patio with a view of the Parthenon and city. The bathroom was a decent size and had been updated and remodeled. The room was adequate for our short stay in Rome. Even though we were located right on the busy street of Emanuele, the noise did not disturb our much needed sleep due to the heavy double doors to the patio. We were equally pleased with the extensive breakfast which included scrambled and hard boiled eggs, lovely pastries, fruit, coffee, juice, cheeses, meat slices and a very large room to accommodate guests. The front desk was helpful and accommodating, as well. We were within easy walking distance to the Parthenon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: bchs74
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, good breakfast room. Its clean and has nice baths. The main attraction is its central location and proximity o public transportation around the city. You can walk to the Vatican, Pantheon, Campo dei Fiori and Piazza Navona easily. The staff is nice. We have stayed twice before and plan to go back. It is a good value. Typical Italy 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient Location”
Reviews.Author: marinanyfedd
Reviews.Content: The location is great! In the middle of historic Rome, conveniently located near by all major attractions with walking distance. Plenty of small cute restaurants on side streets. Safe location. Rooms are small, but not tiny. Beds are really narrow. Clean bathrooms and rooms, air-conditioned. Good buffet breakfast included in the rate. Free Wi-Fi connection within the hotel. Small roof top deck with some lounge chairs and cute view. I think this hotel is great for friends traveling together and exploring Rome entire day, it totally served the purpose for sleeping and getting refreshed for dinners and nights out. Would not stay for romantic couples trip there. I think it was excellent deal for the money we paid. Was super cheap and again location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: absalomLucca
Reviews.Content: We have stayed with some regularity at four hotels in Rome. The first, out on Via Salaria became a private residence and so we booked for the Quatro Fontane and stayed there quite happily five times until they pulled a fast one on us. This was doubly needling as we had been warned on Venere reviews that this particular scam was not uncommon at this hotel. Needless to say we never went there again and instead chose the Alexandra on Via Veneto. Once again we were happy enough to stay there on four visits to the city. However we decided, not for any reasons of dissatisfaction, to try somewhere else a little nearer the centre. We chose the Hotel della Torre Argentina where we have just stayed for the fourth time. The hotel is spotless, the rooms are spacious and air conditioned. There is an attractive bar and a small, airy, light and elegant lounge with a selection of international newspapers. All rooms have Internet connection. The breakfast room can be unhesitatingly recommended, not only for its spaciousness but for the quality and range of food. There is a further added attraction to the Hotel della Torre Argentina for us and that is its situation. Not only are you but five minutes from Palazzo Venezia, Piazza Navona and the Fori but near to (on would be a better description) the Teatro di Pompey where one of the most important and far reaching events in European history took place. The nearby ruins have been excavated and consolidated and information boards surround the site allowing you to appreciate the scale of the complex. The area of the Teatro is huge but of course most has been built upon and the original ground level of the area has been raised considerably. However the breakfast room of the hotel is below modern floor level and there appears to be Roman work down there, both brick work, tufa blocks and pieces of decorative marble. This must be the only hotel in which I have stayed where I've photographed the brickwork! We visit Rome regularly and we can't really envisage staying anywhere else. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Calliope74
Reviews.Content: Excellent position: between Campio de' Fiori, Pantheon and Piazza Navona. Almost any bus stops, tram either at the hotel's door or just opposite. Taxis right next door. River Tevere is within walking distance. Many good restaurants nearby. The hotel was nothing fancy but clean, classic decorated with a good breakfast (by Roman standards). Our room was small but nice enough for 2 adults. Bathroom was really roomy. The only "problem" was that the aircondition unit was just above the beds so it was impossible to sleep with the unit on. Luckily, room #307 turned out to be a really cool room considering the windows were almost always closed (due to heavy traffic) and there was a blistering heatwave every.single.day! Reception men were formal and not very...open but helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Tripper_1700
Reviews.Content: Great , great location very elegant hotel Friendly and helpful staff Good breakfast who needs more?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for the start of our 2 weeks in Italy”
Reviews.Author: MelaniePickus
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Rome and we stayed at Hotel Della Torre Argentina. We saw that it had great reviews on Tripadvisor, and it is very centrally located. My husband and I are huge walkers, and this hotel is about a mile to the Coloseum, and a mile to the Vatican, and a mile to the Trastevere. You are also a few blocks from Campo de Fiori and the Pantheon. Also, if you need to hop on a bus, there is a bustop right in front. We were in a room with a private terrace that had a great view of Rome: Pantheon in one view, the Coloseum in another. Every evening before dinner we would sit on the terrace and have a bottle wine with some cheese with are view of Rome and could look down at all the traffic and people walking along the sidewalk. The staff are very friendly, the breakfast was the best we had our whole trip, and the room was large and comfortable. We did not have any complaints. We will definitely be coming back here on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Zin_NanNan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this place. The hotel is centrally located. A short walk can take you to many major destinations and places worth seeing here. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable enough. The hotel is in the proximity of a busy street with heavy traffic and hence your room gets a bit noisy if windows are left open. Shutting the windows and pulling up the curtains will keep off the noise. As for the other features like the staff, the food, facilities, services, etc, this is a great place. I don’t mind staying at this place again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: NorwayGuran
Reviews.Content: The location is wery good. But its next to a wery busy Street, so it a lot of trafic 24/7. The staff was nice, the romes ok. considered what we paid we got good value fore the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: booandkitty
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 4 nights at this hotel in November ‘10 with a booking through Travel Republic. We were given a room on the second floor overlooking the alley to the left of the hotel. The room was very clean and tidy with a good size bathroom, although there was a slight ‘drain’ smell on occasion. We had no problem with noise during our stay. The continental breakfast was excellent with a good range of items. The best thing about the hotel is it’s location, 25min walk from the Vatican and 20 min from the Colosseum. The worst thing is the centrally controlled air-con. On our first night, the weather was wet and humid which meant the room was too. We asked for the air-con to be turned on and were promised that it would be, but it wasn’t. Fortunately, for the rest of the visit, the weather was dry and sunny so we did not require the air-con. Overall it’s a good hotel with an excellent location to visit all the sights in Rome. How to get there Our flight was with easyJet to Fiumicino (Leonardo da Vinci di Fiumincino) airport. From there, take the Lombardi express train to the Stazione Termini which takes about 20 mins and should cost 14 Euro’s each, one way. On leaving the train BEAR RIGHT and walk about 15 mins down Plat 20 ( I think) until you come to the main concourse and ticket area. Head towards the bus station and catch either the no 40 or the no 60, we got the no 40. You must buy your bus ticket before you board or you might have to pay a 60 Euro fine. We used the quick fares ticket machine and paid 4 euros each, however, if you find a Tobacconists, it should only be 1 euro each. You are supposed to verify your ticket on a machine on board the bus, but they are very crowded 24/7 so don’t worry ( it states on the ticket that you have 45 mins to verify your ticket from boarding). The bus stop to return to the airport is directly outside the hotel front door, BUT the one you need to get off at on arrival is the stop where you have Temple ruins on your left ( Area Sacra) and a bookstore on your right with bright red signage and a road sign that says Largo di Torre Argentina. The hotel is on the corner opposite. Where to eat The restaurant next door to the hotel, Rossopomodoro, is good quality and reasonably priced, just right after a long journey. Taverna Antonina Recommended by another Della Torre visitor on this site, excellent food but expensive, near the Column of Victory. Vinallegro Recommended by our Angel’s tour guide, good food and a very extensive wine list, the entire restaurant is covered in un-drunk bottles from floor to ceiling, located in Trastevere, off via Renella in a small Piazza. Angelino Ai Fori Our personal favourite. Good food and good prices, with a waiter that said ’Oh Yes’ to everything that you said. Located at the junction between Via dei Fori Imperiali and Via Cavour, opposite the forum of Augusto. Taberna Patricii et Plebei Did not eat here, just drinks, but the restaurant has a fantastic ceiling, located near the Trevi fountain on Via del Lavatore(!) Il Delfino Not a restaurant, but a café. The cheapest we found in Rome for coffee, opposite the hotel! One to avoid Although we received excellent service in all the restaurants and cafes we went to, there is always one to spoil it. This one is the café on the upper level of the Colosseum metro stop. Poor service, rude staff and expensive fare. And lastly We went on three tours with Angel Tours in Rome. Please use Trip Advisor to check reviews. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Just a great place to stay in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: DonC
Reviews.Content: The place is clean - it has great bathrooms and a wonderful reception staff. They have become friends to me and those I bring to Rome with me. The breakfast is also very good. Yes, it is right at a bustling bus stop, but that does not affect one's coming and going. It is just a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but noise”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaPattyB
Reviews.Content: The location, close to Piazza Navona, Trive Fountain and the historic district is fine BUT the hotel is located on a corner with bus stop for some 6-8 bus lines. we could not figure out how to regulate the ehat in the room and opening a window on the street side was quite noisy. The bed was hard. This hotel also uses the room card inserted to control the lights and aparently the electricity as well. As a result when out during the day no "toys" could be re-charged. The elevators/lifts are quite small and only one person with luggage could use them at a time. The staff is courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Our second home”
Reviews.Author: Garinca
Reviews.Content: Just returned from yet another great weekend in Rome! We had two top floor rooms again (#501 and #502).The rooms were just fine and extremely clean! Many thanks to the reception staff who are always ready to help. We would certainly recommend it to anyone! Just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and Service for The Price!”
Reviews.Author: maryel998
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and felt that we got more than our money's worth. We selected this hotel based on previous TA reviews. It's location is great...right in the middle of the major Rome sites, including Piazza Navona, Campo de Fiori, the Pantheon (we could see the Pantheon from the private deck outside our room, #502), Trevi Fountain, Imperial Forum/Colosseum, Victor Emanuale Monument. The bus stop is literally outside the front door, which we found very convenient the times we decided to take the bus. The room was quiet, we heard no street noise at all. Rome was hot this week, so the air conditioning was much appreciated. The staff was quite accommodating and willing to help us with any request we had. Every email to them from the original inquiry to the last one just days before we arrived in Rome was promptly answered. The rate quoted in early March was the rate we got in August...85 euro per night, including breakfast. We felt this was a great value considering the location and the service. Please note that the reception area is undergoing renovations. These began on Wednesday, August 11. I don't know how long these will take, but I can't imagine very long. It looked as if they were repainting and possible refurbishing the furniture. But at any rate, I wouldn't let this deter me from making a reservation here. If we are ever in Rome again we certainly would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking! This place is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: EllenPE
Reviews.Content: Hotel Della Torre Argentina is better than 3 stars. I stayed there with my husband for 5 nights in July. We got a deal mentioned on their website: Summer in Rome Special, it was 85 Euro/night. The hotel is in a great location: sandwiched between the Piazza Navona and the Campo de Fiori. It is also in the center of the Torre Argentina transportation hub. We were able to walk nearly everywhere and if we couldn't walk, we could literally step out the hotel door and catch the bus. The hotel itself was super clean with REAL air conditioning. It is on a busy street but we didn't hear a sound. The bathroom was huge by European standards. The breakfast room was very pretty, and there were a lot of food selections, everything delicious. If I had to mention a drawback, its that it isn't in a really pretty neighborhood. But you're in Rome, who cares? I would definitely go back and highly recommend Hotel Della Torre Argentina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: StephenC25
Reviews.Content: I strongly suggest this hotel. Our room was on the back, so no problem with noise. Airconditioning worked perfectly. There was a safe in our room which I was not expecting. Bathroom looked more like a 4-star than a 3-star. Breakfast typical Italian style and filling. Drawback was our bed and pillows....too hard. Customer service from reception could be better but ok. However if you intend to tour Rome by foot then this is your choice. It is within walking ditance to all major sites. Basically, just in the middle of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Better on the inside than it looks on the outside”
Reviews.Author: Tennisnut4
Reviews.Content: Large hotel on busy main road with bus-stop outside. I had a room (118) tucked away at back so no noise problems - good solid windows so maybe rooms at front be ok. Very clean, nice decor, comfortable. Breakfast was great - pastries very yummy. nice dining room in basement but didn't feel dingy. Location was fantastic. 5 mins to Parthenon, right next to antiquities site where Caesar was murdered, 10 mins to Forum. Buses and trams and taxi ranks on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: bluenoseeverton
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 4 days in the beautiful City of Rome. This hotel has absolutely the perfect location to enjoy all the attractions that Rome offers. Approximately 5 minutes walk from Pantheon, 10, minutes to Trevi Fountain, 15 minutes walk to the Colosseum, 20 minutes walk to the Vatican. We did not need to use any public transport at all during our stay. Whilst in Rome we did a couple of Tours with LivItaly (which we would highly recommend doing). Angelo our guide was the perfect host to guide us through this beautiful City, and kept ourselves and 9 year old son thoroughly entertained. The hotel itself was spotlessly clean, the continental breakfast was more than adequate and offered plenty of choice. The only downside, especially for my wife was that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room nor an iron (although there was a trouser press). We wouldn;t hesitate though to use this hotel again and would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “perfect combination of location, price and quality”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityTravels
Reviews.Content: When I was booking a hotel in Rome, I was looking for the perfect combination of location, price and quality. I didn’t have the $$ to just pay top dollar for a 5-star in old Rome so was looking to strike the right balance, and I think this place is that exact balance. I know I saw hotels online (and we passed by) that were cheaper and in the same general area but were not very nice at all. This hotel had an elevator (although narrow) which easily took all our over-packed bags up to our room on the 4th or 5th floor. Our room overlooked the main road. The old Rome area is so quaint and ‘other worldly’ feeling that a minor drawback is walking out of the hotel right onto busy Vittorio Emmanuel, but as soon as you go a block north or south you are in the atmosphere of Rome that is so unique. The location is great, so very close to Pantheon, Campo de Fiori (highly under-appreciated area by the way) and easily walkable to Vatican, Forum, Colloseum, Trevi Ftn and on and on. The people working there were extremely helpful and assisted us in dealing with Air France and our lost bags (we hate Air France, but that’s another story altogether). They also were helpful in us getting a cab to get our rental car, restaurant reservations, directions on taking the bus, and on and on. It’s always great to get good service, and they provided it! The room was a decent size, esp for the cost and phenomenal location. Clean and comfy and room to spread out our bags. The bathroom was surprisingly large and certainly larger then most hotels I’ve seen in Europe/Italy. Slight drawback on sound coming from our neighbor (next door or below, not sure), but it was only when he was clearly shouting on the phone or had his tv blaring which wasn’t too often. Breakfast – No, they didn’t have a full, gluttonous spread like your average Courtyard Marriott or what most Americans are accustomed to back home. They had the standard Italian breakfast which can be good and satisfying (plus not overeat) of yogurt, fruit, rolls, coffee, etc. They also did a nice job in putting it in a large room so it felt spacious and comfortable, so many Italian hotels have the breakfast room as an after that and cram it anywhere. I would certainly stay here again, although next time in Rome I may try to get a place not on the main road and instead on a quaint square to really capture and enjoy that magical essence of Rome. But, should that prove cost or quality prohibitive I’ll happily return here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bucfan66
Reviews.Content: Location is great....central to town, very close to Piazza Navona. Walking distance to Pantheon, Spanish steps, even Vatican. Old building but I guess this is common in Rome. Clean and spacious bathroom. Room was a bit cramped for us four but comfortable. Breakfast not much to write about.....very basic but included in price so made it more tolerable. Hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. Wifi available but only in the lobby so that was inconvenient. Would stay again if price a concern.

Reviews.Title: “The start of our Italian odyssey”
Reviews.Author: JanV
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Della Torre Agentina marked the start of our 2009 European holiday. The hotel is very well located, but on a busy street. The rooms were fine, reasonably sized, extremely clean with good beds. The bath room was spotless. The complimentary breakfast area was nice and offered a good, basic start to the day. We found the hotel front counter staff to be helpful and efficient, but not very warm or engaging. Overall we believe this hotel offered good, basic accommodation and represented good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mpuertorico
Reviews.Content: It is true, perfect location, you can walk to the patheon, the trevi fountain, piazza venezia. If you don't want to walk the bus stop is in front of the hotel and they sell the tickets in the looby. The staff was nice and helpfull, good breakfast. The room and bathroom were the biggest of all the 6 hotels we stay during our trip. They were clean, comfortable with a desk, sofa, mini bar, internet access and two big windows. Without a doubt woul stay here again. Excellent restaurant in the pantheon area, Trattoria de Antonio(behind Caffe d Oro) everything on their homemade part of the menu was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Stop shopping this is the hotel for you in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: CBAnders
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a fabulous week in Rome staying in a triple with my parents for five nights at the Della Torre Agentina. Its incredibly nice. Helpful english speaking personel. Elegant, ultra clean, nonsmoking facility with fabulous breakfast buffet included with hardboiled eggs, quiche, ham, yogurt,fresh pasteries, juice, cappacino, coffee machine, cereals, juice and fresh fruit.. Hotel is elegantly appointed and appears recently remodeled. Rooms ample in size. Very comfortable. Queen sized beds longer than in the US and room included Safe, closet, desk, TV and minibar. Bathroom was marble/tile with bidet, bathe shower, hair dryer and ample hot cold water . Windows are new with double pane and quiet. Air conditioning worked well. Entire facility is smoke free. Room has internet access, bring your own computer or use the internet TV but not included/ Location is prime next to the historic ruins of Area Sacra Dell"Argentina and few blocks from Piazza Nouvena, Pathenon and Fiori del Campo. Its a 15mins walk to the Trevi Fountain and a bit more to the Spanish steps. Safe and clean location with ample shopping and restaurants and great food. We took the Hop on Hop off tour buss ( green ) and VISTA tous of Vatican Museum and Colleseum and Forum. These were astounding!!! I will Definately return to hotel and would not shop any further. You pay more for the location but its definately worth it. It is competitive for the location as well.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: zippy9
Reviews.Content: We were 2 adults and one child (1.5 yrs old) who stayed for 3 nights. We got a fantastic deal on the website and couldn't have asked for a better hotel. We payed much more for other hotels during our stay in Italy and the location was not as good. The rooms are a bit older but clean with recent renovations to the bathroom. They are spacious by European standards. The breakfast was standard issue stuff but always well stocked and tables always cleaned and re-set very quickly. We walked everywhere from this hotel and it was surprisingly quiet despite being on a busy street. It is NOT silent however - there is a bit of a cost to be paid for staying in the middle of Rome. They supplied us with a baby crib which was probably needs to be retired but it worked for the time we were there. All in all a fantastic hotel and would recommend 100%!

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE stay”
Reviews.Author: joannapv
Reviews.Content: we will be returning 12/22 for a week this year have booked 2 rooms this is great hotel!!!! we loved Xmas 2006 in Rome and give this hotel an A plus ...Mrs Mondae

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: eva0128
Reviews.Content: We made some date changes to our Italy trip and I forgot to include an additional night stay to this hotel, so we ended up arriving a day earlier than scheduled. Luckily, the concierge, with the help of Laura (who speaks fluent English), got us into another hotel (Albergo Santa Chiara) for the night. The service at Della Torre Argentina was extremely helpful and we really enjoyed talking to them. The rooms are very close to one another, walls are extremely thin, and the location of the hotel is right off a main street, so we could hear sirens throughout the night and neighbors coming in and out, opening and closing their doors. Our rating of this hotel could be a bit biased, because the neighbors that were by our room were extremely noisy, inconsiderate, and kept knocking on each other's doors in the middle of the night, which made it very difficult to sleep. This happened every night we were there. The breakfast was okay. We have had better breakfast varieties during our stay in Italy. The coffee wasn't home made, but instead came from a machine. The best thing about this place was the impeccable staff. The rooms need some working on.

Reviews.Title: “the best!”
Reviews.Author: Garinca
Reviews.Content: Look no further, becouse this is the place. Unbeatable location, everything is within a walking distance. We spent 4 nights at the end of July, and were greatfull for having 2 top floor rooms (501,502) with spacious private terrace. Breakfast very good with nice spread. Everything was great from check in to check out!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: quechyquat
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed here recently in 3 twin rooms. This hotel's biggest plus point is its location which is 2nd to none!! Centrally located and no more than 15 minutes walk in various directions to the Vatican, Trevi/Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Coloseum etc. A major bus stop outside also serves several routes with frequent buses to Termini train station, and a tram stop around the corner serves Trastevere etc. The standard of the hotel itself is reasonable for a 3 star. Rooms were small but spotless, and the free internet access via TV was a great touch. The bathrooms seemed to be slightly newer than the remainder of the rooms and appeared to have been facelifted recently. The beakfast buffet was well stocked if a little unimaginative. There were no evening meals and the bar area/offering was half hearted. All in all, a good all round 3 star choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: vicktravel
Reviews.Content: It was my second stay at this very well located hotel. For what they charge, it is a good choice. Breafkast is good, rooms are clean and the staff is nice. Was surprised that the internet available on the TV was free of charge. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Cali_Gal_19
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! We can't say it enough. This hotel was central to all the sites we wanted to see - Pantheon, St. Peter's Cathedral, Palatine Hill, Roman Forum, Coliseum, Campo de Fiori and Piazza Navona. We walked everywhere. There was no need to hail a cab or hop on a bus. The hotel itself was fair. The rooms are older but clean. We requested a room on the "quiet" side based on the previous reviews we read. Although there was no view, it was well worth it since the hotel sits on a major avenue. The included breakfast was terrific and definitely a great way to start our day. We would recommend this hotel to our closest friends and family. We would definitely stay here again based solely on the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerISR
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a long weekend in the Hotel Della Torre Argentina. The location is perfect, you can walk everywhere easily. The room was more than we expected – big enough, comfortable, quite, and clean - Excellent value. The staff was nice, helpful, spoke good English and did their best. The breakfast buffet is varied and gives you a good start for the day. We'll definitely recommend this hotel to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Diana0
Reviews.Content: Great 3* hotel, near the main the top attractions in Rome, Colloseum, Piazza Navona, Pantheon. The rooms are smal, but very clean. For a weekend I tinhk is one of the best in Rome, not to expensive with a great location

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Esploratore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October 2008 for two nights and arrived by car. The hotel does not have its own parking but has an arrangement with a nearby garage (payment through hotel). It is not easy to find but the porter came along in the car to show where is was. On the brief walk back to the hotel he was full of tips on the city. When returning to the Hotel all the check-in arrangements had been completed and we could head straight into the city. A very pleasant welcome to the Hotel. The location is really unbeatable, in the centre between Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and Campo de Fiori. All of these sights were not more than a few minutes on foot. The room was not very large but clean and comfortable, the bathroom was very large and also clean. Facilities were up to par (pay tv, internet etc.). The windows were very well insulated to keep out the city noise. In short, a very pleasant stay in the very centre of Rome. It is nice to see a hotel not abusing its amazing location! It is formally a three star but I have stayed in a few 4 star hotels that would score a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderul employees”
Reviews.Author: albiwan
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel and the employees were wonderful. We had just left a previous hotel in Rome which was terrible and checked into the Della Torre Argentina late and on spec. The manager was superb and let us view the room before we checked in; his attitude was simply amazing. The room was superb and breakfast very nice. The location of the hotel couldn't be bettered, although our room overlooked the main road so it was a little noisy. If we visit Rome again we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BiagiodiMaratea
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, just a stroll from Piazza Navona, Campo de' Fiori, Trastevere, .... Great hotel, good service, good clean rooms, great breakfast). This hotel is our second home, as Rome is indeed our second home city ! There's a busstation in front of the hotel, the rooms at the front side (despite the double glass insulation) have to deal with trafific noise. But from approx. 22.00 to 07.30 hours it's no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Good Value (for Rome, anyway)”
Reviews.Author: Proflcopter
Reviews.Content: This was a great value in an excellent location, right in the heart of Rome. The rooms were clean if a little small and all the various stuff worked (a miracle for Italy, in my experience). The staff were patient, helpful and did their best in whatever language you cared to try. If you are looking for cheap, this isn't it, but if you are in Rome for less than a week, take my advice and stay here - don't spend all your time on a bus or train. The Campo de Fiori and other great hot-spots are nearby, but not on your back porch, and most of Rome is easily walkable from here. The breakfast was also excellent, and had something for every pallet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, excellent location, great price”
Reviews.Author: JPanda08
Reviews.Content: My family and I just took a long weekend in this hotel after checking out reviews on this site. I highly recommend it to those looking for value for money. The hotel has a great location and very competitive pricing. We stayed in the quad room, we were all very impressed, with the room sizes and facilities. They were even able to provide us a cot for the baby with no extra charge. We had an outdoor terrace, which whilst facing inwards onto the hotel and hence not having any real view, was quite from the road noise. Please note others comments about the hotel bar, I never saw it open during my stay. I would definitely return next time I'm in Rome. Thanks to the contributors to this site, you helped me select a winner for our trip. Jonathan Crawford

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Beccy1234
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a 3 night stay in the Hotel Della Torre Argentina. The location is fanatastic, meaning you can walk everywhere easily. We only got on a bus to St Peter's, and this took less than 10 minutes and stops outside the hotel. The room was fantastic - we had a private terrace, which had views over Rome and was easily large enough for a table and 4 chairs. The room itself was nicely decorated and the bathroom was new, with a great shower and lots of natural light. Although its on a main road we couldn't hear the traffic at night. The staff were always very helpful and spoke great English. I emailed the hotel before our stay and they replied that day. The breakfast buffet is varied and of a good quality. Easily enough to fill you up for a day of sites. The location means you can also stop back at your hotel to enjoy a break and the air con! We'll definitely be going back to the Hotel Della Torre Argentina.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location”
Reviews.Author: KimGN
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in April at the Hotel Della Torre Argentina. The overall stay was pleasant, although the rooms were a bit small. The internet was free, but only wireless in the lobby, so I brought my own Apple Airport Express. There was supposed to be a bar, but it was never manned and when we asked one night, we were told that it was closed. Good thing that so many places in the vicinity was open then. It is really central, less than 300 meters to Piazza Navonna, Pantheon, Campo di Fiori. The rooms were reasonably sound proof. I will certainly count it in the next time I go to Rome, although it wasn't exactly cheap. The general quality of the hotel and the very central location made up for it. The elevators were very small, and we had a good laughter about how they would cramp 4 people into one, where we could hardly fit two grown-ups.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Flavia_Brazil
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, you can go everywhere in walking distance. The staff was really great! The room size was good and confortable (I was in a double). I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This Torre is truly argentina”
Reviews.Author: travelchika22
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading great reviews from other travelers. Well, it was all true. I'm going to say it right now, if you're on a budget, watch out. If you have money to spare, keep reading. I stayed in two different rooms, and had a bunch of friends that stayed in many more. NOTA BENE: If you want a non-smoking room, specify it. But this floor is at the very top, just for your info. Good thing is, even the smoking rooms didn't smell like smoke. I don't know how they do it. This hotel is fantastic. After spending my time sweating in the hot sun all day long, I was able to go up to my room using an elevator or lift (whatever you want to call it), take a shower, and enjoy the AC (air conditioning). I was truly relaxed, watched TV, took a nap, and was ready to go out again. The location is incredible. I visited important sights on foot. The Campo de Fiore is 3 minutes away. It's a very well-known American location so be cautious. I didn't experience any problems at all though. The staff at the front desk are extremely nice and helpful. Considering they had a huge bunch of college girls, they didn't even show impatience one time. They recommended places, etc. Very nice people. Okay, don't be shocked at the size of the elevator. If you are alone and have big bags, let the front desk person keep an eye on your stuff while you take up one bag at a time. If you're really overweight, sorry, you have to take the steps. Good news is, breakfast is a fantastic buffet!!! Hey, don't look dumb when you're trying to pour juice out of the machine. Press the button with that has a cup icon at the top. I think staff enjoy the fact that no one can figure it out the first time!!! haha. It's funny. Okay, the only things I didn't like about the hotel were the overpriced beverages, movies, and internet service. I mean, at least the internet is very convinient. You can use your laptop, or the TV if you prefer. Oh, some of the cleaning stuff, I guess they feel intimidated or something, because they don't say Hi or Excuse me when they go by you. Anything else?? No, I think I have said all I had to say. Good luck, and have fun in Roma P.S. in the pic you can see the room i was in. all pink!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ggm_hk
Reviews.Content: Thanks to hotel's ideal location, we were able to go easily & efficiently to wherever we wished. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was because a great bookstore - La Feltrinelli situating just opposite to the hotel, where we bought my favorite CDs of Italian singers. These are really difficult to get in Hong Kong. We also enjoyed strolling around Campo di Fiori. The spices & dried herbs we got there always remind us of Rome. As a gift idea for someone special, my choice will be; - Ai Monasteri (wonderful sweets), - St Maria Novella Pharmacy (no need to travel as far as Firenze), - Murano Piu (probably the loveliest Venetian glass handicrafts in Rome). All are located near Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bw-7
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back from a 3 night stay at this hotel with 2 young kids. The staff were friendly and helpful. The quad room was a great size, really clean with all facilities required. The location is just great, 5 minutes from the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. 10-15 minutes from Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The 110 tour bus is only 3 minutes walk away for easy access to all sites. The only issue I had was a noisy road it was on, but it didn't affect anyone's sleep! Would definitely recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: STUEY/LUEY
Reviews.Content: Great location for those who want to be in the center of all of the tourist attractions. Although I woudn't consider the hotel staff overly friendly, they were more than helpful when we needed assistance. You couldn't beat the location, I can't say that enough. The room was great, after travelling throughout Italy for 2 weeks, it was an overall great room. Jo the bartender was awesome. I would recommend this hotel for sure to anyone and will stay there again on our next trip to Rome. Jody & Al Falconio

Reviews.Title: “Below Average, would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: gotham3
Reviews.Content: We spent Aug 12th through Aug 15th at this Rome Hotel. We had one double on the top floor with a terrace and another double on 4th floor. Cons: Horribly small and dirty rooms. Especially for Americans used to large rooms; take permission from the walls before you move around! VERY dirty carpet, ripped wallpaper, bad smell in rooms, burnt comfortor cover!!! I kept my shoes on the whole time as I felt I might catch something. The bed was sunk in the middle, very uncomfortable. Pros: The price is right at Euro 90 for a double and it is in the heart of ancient Rome. You can walk to everything: Spanish steps, Trevi fountain; Collosium, Vatican. But I think you will be in a happier mood by spending a little more and staying somewhere cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Unforgivable Service”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl66
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel over the July 4th holiday. 4 adults and one child shared a two room suite and while the accomodations were a bit pricey ($500 US per night for a two room suite) they were tolerable. What was unbelievable was the service, which was referred to in a prior post here on tripadvisor. The 5 of us get to the lobby the morning we were to leave and were told by an extremely unfriendly desk clerk that we could not get a cab because there was a taxi strike. We hadn't looked at a paper or TV news program in days, so we had no idea about the strike. The hotel easily could have informed guests departing that day that they needed to leave plenty of time to make other arrangements in the event of a strike. Strikes occur a lot in Italy, but the response of the clerk was unbelievable. He didn't care at all how we were to get to FCU in time for our flight that morning. He told us to go out to the square, maybe we could catch a ride there - knowing full well that every cab in Rome was striking. We went out with all of our bags into the street, and begged someone to tell us how to get to the airport. The striking cabbies told us what the clerk couldn't be bothered to share - we had to take a tram and make a train connection to get to the airport. We barely made our flight, but I know that many people were stranded. This jerk from the Torre della Argentina didn't give a damn about us and he should look up the definition of the words "hospitality business" before he goes back to work.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Rome hotel May 22 - May 24, 2006 and in general were pleased with our experience. We had requested and received a room on the 4th floor with balcony and were more than pleasantly surprised at how lovely the balcony was. Enough room for a table and chairs and a view of the back of the Pantheon, a small part of St. Peter's Basilica and the Vittorio Emmanuele monument. Despite being on a busy street, being on the 4th floor and the double glazing of the windows was more than enough to keep the room quiet. Our shower did not drain that well and the bottom would collect water as we showered. Our room was tastefully decorated, a little worn but comfortably European with lovely cove ceiling and wonderful lithographs of ancient Rome. And the refrigerator was nice to keep our wine in to drink later on our balcony. The elevator does stop one floor below the 4th but the one flight of stairs up to the 4th floor is wide and easily managed. Being pretty well prepared we required little assistance from the front staff, but when we arrived I was immediately given a fax I was waiting for, without having to ask about it, allowing me to finalize some plans. That was nice. The breakfast was typical European, sparse but fresh and adequate for those not looking for typical American "grand-slam." The bus stop really is right outside the door and often many people standing there that you have to wade through to get to the door. Really only a problem when you were burdened with luggage. 5 minute walk to Pantheon, Piazza Navona and a taxi station 100 feet outside the door. I thought the hotel pleasant, well located, and good value for the money and would stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location.”
Reviews.Author: RTravel
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Rome Hotel - moderately priced in the heart of Rome. Great location - walk to Piazza Navona, Pantheon - Forum, just about everywhere. Cab to Vatican is the easiest way about 5E. Book direct with hotel to save - call - Stephano speaks good English. A single room is small but not too cramped. Refrigerator in room. Large bathroom. Very extensive delicious buffet breakfast is included. Stephano can provide restaurant recommendations. AC, elevator, comfortable. No view from room but then wasn't in Rome to look out the window. View from roof if you like. Bus 40 stops right in front of hotel - direct to train station. Also tram stop nearby to Trastavere. Date of stay May 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ben_Lpool
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastically located for all Rome has to offer. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful in providing directions and suggesting where to go. Although the hotel is right on the main road (Corso Emannuelle) there is effective sound deadening - external shutters, heavy duty double glazing and internal light/sound blockers. I stayed in room 404 which has a luxurious bathroom (the biggest on the floor according to the fire exit plan). However the room of choice is on the 5th floor overlooking the front of the hotel as it has a balcony and shares the views of the roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: ktomom
Reviews.Content: Hotel Torre Delle Argentina is in a very good location to many sites in Rome. Walking distance to almost everything, (10 - 15 minutes to most sites) don't think I would attempt the Vatican unless you are very used to walking ALOT. Very good breakfast. They did not tend to replenish some of the breakfast items that they ran out of, and we had to ask for replenishments. They did it with hesitation. Although the location is good and buses are right at the front door, some might think this very convenient, it is to a point, but it is always very crowded around the front door of the hotel and sometimes slightly difficult to get into the front door of the hotel. Some people got peturbed that you asked them to move in order to just get into the front door; typical Roman attitude...! Overall we liked the hotel pretty good. We have stayed at other hotels in Rome on previous trips that I liked just a little better, but the price is good, especially for the location. If my other two favorites were not available, I would not hesitate to stay here again! Room 312 was really good for a family of 4 - it was like a little apartment with a cute little balcony - no view though! Good choice if you are doubting other places. Just a little note - there is a relatively new "attracton", which is a movie on the history of Rome, last 2750 years. Its just down the street from the Vittorio Emmanuelle II monument and on the Via del Corso, its called the Roman Time elevator and worth seeing early on in your trip. Lasts about 45 minutes. Really good history and info. Think we paid 9 euros per adult. Find coupons in the hotels, otherwise they charge you 11 or 12 Euros per adult, slightly reduced rate for children. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a two day break in Rome stayed at the hotel Della Torre Argentina . The hotel was in a great location easy to walk to all of the attrractions in a maximum of 15-20 mins. Our room was a good size and at the back of the hotel so was quiet at night even though you are on a very busy road and after all of the walking that you will do whilst in Rome you will need a good nights sleep. The room itself was of a good size with lovely high ceilings and excellent bathroom . The hotel was very clean throughout and the staff were very polite and helpful there is a nice breakfast room which is situated in the cellar of the hotel has a nice feel to it and the continental breakfast is plentiful and will set you up for a day of sightseeing. The hotel is also very easy to get to from the airport we flew into Ciampini where you can get a bus into Termini the main railway station from there you can catch either the 64 or 40 bus which stops just across the road from the hotel .So with all of this in mind i can thoroughly recommend the hotel as a great place to stay whilst in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 19 year old daughter for 3 nights from 23rd January 2006 and fully agree with all the previous reviews. The hotel is in a superb location with everything on the doorstep and at no time day or night did we feel threatened as 2 women alone. The receptionists were very helpful and you can buy all tour bus and ordinary bus tickets from the front desk. We stayed at the front of the hotel on the 3rd floor but the noise wasn't an issue. The biggest noise came from the millions of birds at dusk right beside the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location”
Reviews.Author: EdwardBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: This is an incredibly centrally located hotel, right next to Largo Argentina, which may be the oldest archeological site in Rome. We found the room to be quite comfortable, if a bit small, and the marble-clad bathroom to be very luxurious. The breakfast was excellent. There was a large spread of cereal, fruit, hard boiled eggs, pastries, various Italian meats, cheeses, yogurt, milk, juices and coffee. It made for a solid foundation to a day of touring. The staff spoke English and were knowledgable and helpful. The hotel is located on a very busy street, the Corso Vittorio Emanuelle II. There are buses that stop right in front of the hotel and a trolley station right around the corner. The street itself is very noisy. We asked for a room at the back, and found it to be perfectly quiet, with the exception of some hallway noises in the morning. In short, we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Della Torre Argentina for the last two nights of our honeymoon, and were quite pleased with the building, the service, and the location. The bus stop is right outside the front door, so it is easy to use. For those of us not fluent in Itilian the hotel desk will tell you what number bus you need to get anywhere in the city. The hotel interior was charming with high ceilings that made the room feel very large. I feel it is a good value considering the prices of other hotels in the city. Possibly the biggest benefit to this hotel is its proximity to what I consider the best restaraunt in Italy, Ristorante Spirito DiVino, in Trastevere. I would encourage anyone going to Rome to stay in this hotel and to make at least one trip to this restaurant. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Torre Argentina has a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Torre Argentina for 10 days in September 2005 and found the hotel spotlessly clean and well run with the beds and towels changed every day. The location is ideal for sightseeing being only a 5 minute walk from the Pantheon, Piazza Navano and Piazza Fiori. The rooms were adequate though a little dark due to being on a narrow street. If I went again I would ask for rooms on the 4th flooras they are above the rooftops and have good views. The air conditioning took a bit of working out but can be controlled from reception. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice for a continental breakfast. The staff were polite and helpful without being overly friendly. I would rate this hotel as above average for a Rome hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Grumpy Reception”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just right for our trip to Rome. The rooms were very clean, breakfast was terrific, and the location was perfect. The room we had was relatively quiet, as it was on the backside of the building (looking out over a Chinese food restaurant). It was very close to the Campo di Fiori, which was great for shopping and general piazza atmosphere. One note, however was the extremely grumpy man at the reception desk (he seemed incredibly put out at every question or request, from the nearest ATM to where to buy a bus ticket). We didn't catch his name, but trust me, you will know which one he is if you come across him. Other than our experience with him, the rest of the staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Four Days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ANNEV42
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this excellent hotel. Very clean with friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast room excellent . Will definitely stay here again. Booked direct with the hotel by email and telephone after looking at review on TripAdvisor Ideal location in the historic centre, we walked to all of the main tourist sites in the city. Would advise you take plenty of water on your days out and about - we visited at the end of May and temperatures were in the low to mid 30's every day. Get up early have breakfast from 7am and visit the city before the crowds and heat build up and the city is invaded by all those tour guides with the brollies and flags. St Peters Basilica is a must and the view of the city from the top was worth those 320 difficult steps (after the lift!) Book for a visit to Vatican Museums - they have a website - the queues are enormous! The Pantheon can be seen from the hotel roof top and is a short stroll away - beautiful. The Roman Forum, Colosseum are fantastic - a lot of crowds around, again go early or around about lunchtime to get into the Colosseum (all the tours go for lunch). If you are feeling like another climb but a short walk, the views of the Colosseum and Forum and City from Palantine Hill are well worth the effort. The birth place of Rome. Eating out is everywhere - take your pick! Taxi to the airport from hotel was 50euros. We also took a bus from Airport to Train terminal, then a white taxi to hotel - approx 30 euros and 8 for the bus ride. One small note: There are toilets at all of the main sites, which were always clean and staffed! Enjoy Rome and the Hotel della torre Argentina.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelRs
Reviews.Content: Hotel Della Torre Argentina Corso Vittorio Emanuele, 102 Rome This is a 3 star hotel with several amenities usually found in higher class establishments. Since the hotel we were staying at for most of our visit didn't have a room for the last 2 nights, we booked this hotel through ReservationsItaly (De Angelis Viaggi) who was able to get us a decent sized double room with ensuite bath for 145 Euros per night including breakfast for 2. The room faced the very noisy Via Della Torre Argentin but the soundproof windows and shutters blocked all the noise. The room was somewhat smaller than the one we had at the In Parione, had a queen size bed, mini-bar, clothes presser, satellite TV, direct dial phone, large wardrobe and desk. The bathroom had a good size shower. There are elevators (very narrow ones) and a shoe buffer in the hallway. Breakfast was served buffet style in two rooms in the large, ground floor lounge area. There was a large selection of cereals, fruits, meat, cheese, bread, pastries, juices and hot beverages and, on Sunday morning hard boiled eggs. Staff was attentive and spoke English well. The 64 bus to the Termini train station (about a 10-15 minute ride depending on traffic) as well as numerous other buses stop right outside the front door. The tram to Trastevere is down the block and the hotel is within easy walking distance of the Piazza Navona, Campo Di Fiore, the Ghetto, many restaurants and bars. The Saturday night passegiata on the Torre Della Argentina is a great sight to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: SusLau
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply perfect - rooms are wonderful - stay at 501 and you will have a big balcony with a fantastic view, breakfast excellent - you are within walking distance to everything - will only stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: zdoggyz
Reviews.Content: We love this place. We've stayed here about 3 times and it never disappoints. We've always gotten a large room and always the room's been very quiet, which is rare in Rome. The location is superb...nothing is more than 15 minutes away. The breakfasts are fantastic too; usually we dont avail ourselves of hotel breakfasts at other places. The bathrooms are huge too. In short, Rome is our favorite location in the world, and this is our favorite place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Della Torre Argentina
HotelInfo.Address: Corso Vittorio Emanuele II, 102, 00186 Rome, Italy
